images.caption: Persian Walnut – male flowers are in 3–10 cm long, yellow-green catkins
Persian Walnut – female flowers are inconspicuous, usually 2-5 are clustered, they have distinct yellow stigmas
Persian Walnut – sprouting leaves are reddish, there are scars on the branches left by last year’s leaves
Persian Walnut – the bark is grey, cracked in older trees
Persian Walnut – colorized drawing by Josef Dohnal
